fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62984].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Entries in the activity stream with same time stamp may not show up in the correct order as it had occurred

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# To get an occurance of same timestamp, you will have to use an plugin like [JIRA Automation Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin/server/overview]
# Create a simple automation to add a comment on issue creation
# Create an issue and go to the created issues activity tab

h3. Expected Results
The activity tab always shows the latest update on top. Therefore it is expected that the on top of the activity stream tab of the issue, you should see the comment and the last should be issues created as it is the fist task:
!correct.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes this is logged correctly, however at times it appears the other way around:
!incorrect.png|thumbnail!
Where the comment is logged as added first in activity stream.  

h3. Notes
* From the database from the jiraissue and jiraaction table, we see that it has the exact time stamp to the millisecond, therefore it seems that JIRA isn't able to determine which is the first event. 
* perhaps for this case, we can make JIRA always have create issue the first item in the activity stream to avoid this incorrectness in the future.
fields.summary: Entries in the activity stream with same time stamp may not show up in the correct order as it had occurred

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62983].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when filtering for a weekly period on the 'Recently Created' chart, JIRA will display 'Week 1' - 'Week 2' - 'Week 3' instead of displaying the actual date.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
JIRA should allow users to choose between the current format and displaying the actual date.
fields.summary: Recently Created chart should display actual date

fields.description:
*Summary*

Custom Field Wiki Style Renderer Has *User Mention* Button Which Custom Field Doesn't Support Mention In The First Place

Step to reproduce:
 - Create a custom field with *Text Field (multi-line)*
 - Assign to any screen
 - Navigate to *Field Configuration* page (or press "gg" and search for Field Configuration)
 - Click on *Configure* button on any field configuration that contained your custom field.
 - Navigate to your custom field and click on "Renderers" button.
 - Choose *Wiki Style Renderer*
 - The custom field will look like the below image:

  !add user mention menu option.png|thumbnail!

In conclusion, *User Mention* button does not belong in that custom field since custom field does not support mention. There is a feature request for this case.
fields.summary: Custom field wiki style renderer has User Mention Button which custom field doesn't support mention in the first place

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After upgrading JIRA from 6.3.x to 7.1.x, when editing a gadget, the filter used there displays as filter_id instead of showing its name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On JIRA 6.3.x, add a few gadgets based on filter results, such as "Issue Statistics" and "Created vs. Resolved Chart"
# Upgrade JIRA 6.3.x to JIRA 7.1.x
# Access the dashboard that contain the gadgets and click on {{Edit}} for one of them

h3. Expected Results

The filter name is displayed formally there.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will display filter_id instead.
 
h3. Notes
This happens because the gadgets do have missing entries on the 'gadgetuserpreference' table.

h3.Workaround
Editing the existing gadget will add the entries on the 'gadgetuserpreference' table.
fields.summary: Upgrading JIRA breaks the filter name on Gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the *External User Management* option is turned on, the _Can't Access Your Account_ option still shows up when logging in from the mobile link: http://<hostname>/plugins/servlet/mobile#login
h3. Environment

JIRA using LDAP, with the External User Management option turned on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to  *Administration > System > General, *and enable *External User Management*.
 # Navigate to the standard login page at http://<hostname>/secure/Dashboard.jspa and note that the _Can't Access Your Account _link is not present.
 # Navigate to the mobile login page at http://<hostname>/plugins/servlet/mobile#login and notice that the _Can't Access Your Account_ link appears, and throws a 503 error when clicked.

h3. Expected Results

 _Can't Access Your Account_ is removed from all login pages.
h3. Actual Results

 _Can't Access Your Account_ is only removed from the standard login page, not the mobile one. 
h3.  
h3. Workaround

None currently.
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile Does Not Respect "External User Management" Setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding watchers or editing watchers, if you then click on the comment field immediately to enter a comment the cursor will then lose focus when the watcher window closes and this causes you to inadvertently activate a hotkey in JIRA or causes you to have to take an extra step of manually closing the watcher window and then placing the cursor in the comment field.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the watcher window
# click in the comment window and attempt to start to type
# When the watcher window closes the cursor loses focus on the comment window 

h3. Expected Results
When clicking in the comment field the cursor should not lose focus.

h3. Actual Results
Cursor loses focus on the comment window when the watcher window closes

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Cursor loses focus on comment window
Look and Feel Colour Configuration does not affect Activity Stream on Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While attempting to edit the Issue Description or the Issue Comment field in the Visual mode, the color of all links on the current issue screen will be changed to the default blue color until the page is refreshed.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Change the *link color* to another color via {{JIRA Administration > System > USER INTERFACE > Look and feel}}.
# Ensure that the *Rich Text Editor* is enabled via {{JIRA Administration > System > USER INTERFACE > Rich text editor}}.
# Go to any existing issue, all link's color should be in the new selected color.
# Edit the Description or Comment inline, if it's in _Text_ mode, change to the _Visual_ mode.
 [^visualMode.mp4] 

h3. Expected Result
The links' color shouldn't change when the Description or Comment field is in the edit mode.

h3. Actual Result
The link's color changes back to the default blue color until the page is refreshed.
fields.summary: When the Description or Comment field is in the Visual mode, all the links on the screen will be displayed with the default color instead of the chosen color

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Velocity template is not correctly converted to HTML on an issue page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Go to the issue page
# Open a developer tool in your browser
# Search elements with a keyword "$i18n.getText"
# You can see the following text in a <span> tag
{code}
$i18n.getText('security.level.explanation', $currentSelection)
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The text should be converted to a valid message about security level.

h3. Actual Results

As I mentioned above, the text wasn't converted to the valid message.

 !$i18n.getText.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

* This bug didn't cause any problem
* Once you update security level of a comment, the text was converted to a valid message
 !after_changing_restriction.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

No workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Velocity template is not correctly converted to HTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62971].
  {panel}

*Problem*

 It is currently not possible to restrict the information from the activity stream to appropriate groups or users. It only disables it Globally. However, this cannot prevent the user to add the activity stream on the dashboard again. 

A simple example would be if the user does not have permission to access Confluence, this message will display on the Activity Stream. :

{quote}

Additional information may be available, please authenticate for more information:
Authenticate with Confluence.
{quote} 

!image-2016-10-27-16-30-19-607.png|thumbnail!

 

Clicking the X button will only remove it temporarily but once the page reloads, it will re-appear. 

 

*Suggestion *

Introduce the ability to restrict the Activity stream based on user, group , role. etc.
fields.summary: Restrict activity stream based on user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62967].
  {panel}

*Use Case / Description of Problem* 

As a JIRA Server user, I search using Google for the "JIRA API" I encounter the Cloud documentation.

[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/]

This page does not include an easy way to switch to the Server documentation.
 * There is only one mention, "For a high level overview of the JIRA REST API in JIRA Server, start with the [JIRA REST API home|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+APIs]."
 * Clicking this goes to DAC documentation, not to the Server version of the docs.AC REST page
 * From that page user must click "JIRA APIs" then "Latest Production Version"

*Suggested Improvement* 
 * Make it so that the cloud version of this page contains a link to the server version.

*Suggestion Two* 

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/ 

Does not have an easy way to change to a previous version of this page. It would be great if the server version included a link to the list of all versions, [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/]
fields.summary: Improve links between server and cloud versions of JIRA REST API Reference

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62966].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Currently when a JIRA Admin changes the Base URL there is no register of who made it. On environments where there are multiple admins it can be hard to trace.

h5. Description
Add entries on the Audit Logs to show who and when someone changes the Base URL. It is understandable that someone can also manipulate the logs directly on the database, but it would be much more sense to have this logged on the application level.
fields.summary: Register on Audit log when Base URL is changed
Automatically redirect if Project KEY in URL typed in using incorrect capitalization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62964].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

I'd like to preface this with saying that the current session timeout behavior is not in question here; this is a request for an additional feature that will terminate a user's session.

We're looking to fulfill a security requirement for our organization that will kick a user out of there current session and redirect them to a log in page automatically, much like a banking website.

Currently a session timeout results in the user seeing a cached page and once they click on something they are directed to provide their credentials. What we'd like to happen (again as an additional feature, not a change to the core functionality of a session timeout) is an automatic redirect to a log in screen.

The end goal is to not leave potentially sensitive information visible to unauthorized users.

Preferably, enabling this setting in crowd would apply this behavior to all products involved, e.g., Jira, Confluence, etc.. That said enabling this setting on individual components is acceptable as well.

The support ticket that this is in reference to is CWDSUP-12774
fields.summary: Redirect to login after session timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62961].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
On this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-828787693.html
it states "Admin privileges are required because a normal user can't access the uSNChanged attribute..."

However, Microsoft's documentation 
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/891995
(and several other sources I've seen) states that "you do not have to configure special user account permissions or group permissions for the program. The program only requires List and Read permissions for every container and leaf object in the subtree that is searched."


h3. Expected Results
If there's really no need for an admin user as Microsoft states, our docs shouldn't state this is required.
fields.summary: Documentation error regarding LDAP permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62960].
  {panel}

I love that JIRA can send email for _every_ action on a ticket, including mine, so that I can look at my email thread and see a full record of everything that happened. Also, that searching in my email lets me search for my own words and findings as well, and I don't have to go somewhere else to search for them (unlike what many services like, say, Github do with their notifications: not sending me mine, which I hate). I love this!

But:

It does get annoying sometimes to do a bunch of actions in JIRA and immediately get many emails in my inbox. So I'd like emails for actions triggered by me to be treated specially somehow, so that I can filter them in Gmail (e.g. automatically mark them as read).

Ideas for "treated specially somehow" may be: they could contain a particular string, which I could filter on. Another cool idea is what Github has started doing recently: if you're getting a notification because you were mentioned, the email you get is cc-ed to {{Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>}}. If you're getting a notification because you were the author, the email you get has a cc to {{Author <author@noreply.github.com>}}. 

May it be possible for JIRA to do something similar, e.g. the email's "from" address could be "<UserName>-JIRA <jira@zenefits.com>" with the text in the from changing based on whose action triggered the email? (Right now, the from header is always: "Notifications (JIRA) <jira@zenefits.com>".)
fields.summary: Some way to tag JIRA emails triggered by my own actions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Enabling _Access logging_ (at [ *Administration* > *System* > *Logging & Profiling* ] ) might cause JIRA to stall. Incoming thread will be fighting for {{org.apache.log4j.Logger}} lock in {{AccessLogFilter}} 
 Those logs will be written into {{atlassian-jira-http-access.log}} file in <JIRA_HOME>/logs/ folder.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Access logging
 # Generate high load
 # Start active logging something in different thread.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA works fine
h3. Actual Results

JIRA stalls.
 * Almost all incoming http threads are *blocked waiting* to obtain the logger lock to log Access log data from {{AccessLogFilter}} - *LockID_1*
 * Thread _http1_ hold the lock *LockID_1*, but it waits for another lock *LockID_2*
 * Thread _http2_ holds the lock *LockID_2* and does slow execution of some other task during that.

h5. Thread dump details

Example of one the threads waiting for *LockID_1*:
{code:java}

	- waiting to lock <0x000000040135e018> (a org.apache.log4j.Logger)
	at org.apache.log4j.Category.forcedLog(Category.java:391)
	at org.apache.log4j.Category.log(Category.java:856)
	at org.slf4j.impl.Log4jLoggerAdapter.info(Log4jLoggerAdapter.java:304)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.accesslog.AccessLogFilter.preFilterCallStep(AccessLogFilter.java:194)
...
{code}
Thread _http1_
{code:java}

   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
	at org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton.doAppend(AppenderSkeleton.java:231)
	- waiting to lock <0x0000000401138288> (a org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender)
	at com.atlassian.jira.logging.JiraHomeAppender.doAppend(JiraHomeAppender.java:206)
	at org.apache.log4j.helpers.AppenderAttachableImpl.appendLoopOnAppenders(AppenderAttachableImpl.java:66)

h3. Summary
JIRA Create Screen *Configure fields* UI will not render correctly (not CF are listed) if screen has a high number of fields and/or tabs

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.x, JIRA 7.2.x, JIRA 7.3.x
* Firefox 49.0.2
* Chrome 54.0.2840.71 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a screen with a high number of fields and tabs
#* You might need to resize the windows, at it depends on proportion
 # Click on the *Configure fields* button to manage the fields you want the screen to show

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will show all fields available for the screen in *Configure fields* UI

h3. Actual Results
The window has a delimited size and don't show fields bellow the delimited size, either on *All* or *Custom*
* Example1:
!configurefield.png|thumbnail!

* Example2:
 !Missing_fields.png|thumbnail! 
** Note fields are missing: _Text11_ and _Text9_ 

h5. Notes
Looks like problem in dynamic computation of *Configure fields* UI areas
 !Missing_fields_box.png|thumbnail! 

* External box
{code:html}
<div class="aui-inline-dialog-contents contents" style="width: 450px; max-height: 403px;">
{code}
*  Inner box
{code:html}
<div class="qf-picker-content qf-picker-unconfigurable" style="max-height: 371px;">
{code}

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, can you add below CSS style in announcement banner:
{code}
<style>
div.qf-picker-content {
max-height: 400px !important;
}
</style>
{code}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62952].
  {panel}

I recently set up email notifications on our local JIRA server installation, afterwards I was looking through the online documentation on where jira stores the settings for the various email servers you can configure (again, information like this would be really helpful, but is often lacking)

After some quick searches through the servers file system revealed that none of the settings I made could be found anywhere in the filesystem i started looking through database for the jira installation, surely enough, there is a table named "mailservers".

The column "mailpassword" holds the the password for each server as plain text, unsalted and unhashed.

Could we please have proper password storage for the email server configuration?
fields.summary: Do not store password for email servers as plain text in jira app db

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62938].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In cluster with many JIRA nodes receiving CRUD operations and each creation action for Lucene index, each node need to catchup on operation from another nodes.
 Currently there is no visibility to JIRA Administrator about this process. 
 Health-check index consistency is a false positive in many cases like that, see -JRA-61501-
h3. Suggested Solution

Create UI tool to visualize the state of operation replication queue, show if node is lagging behind.
h3. Workaround

Check tables: {{nodeindexcounter}}, {{replicatedindexoperation}}, {{clusternode}}
h5. New REST API

As part of JIRA 7.2.10 there is a new REST API available. 
 REST endpoint: GET {{<JIRA context>/rest/api/2/index/summary}}

Please see docs for details:
 * REST Doc: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.10/#api/2/index/summary]
 * Java Doc: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.2.10/com/atlassian/jira/index/summary/IndexSummarizer.html]
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator for JIRA Datacenter I want to know state of replication queue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Filter subscription notifications and issue navigator results will attach images to plain text emails if images are being displayed in the filter results.
Examples of images could be coming from the priority or issue type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Under the user profile, change the email type from html to text
# Run a JQL query
# Share the query result with a user that has the email type set to text

h3. Expected Results
The filter results get emailed to the user in question.
Any fields which are displayed in the filter result in images will be absent from the email

h3. Actual Results
The images relevant to the result of the filter instead will get added as attachment to the plain text email.
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour appears to have changed since JIRA 7.
In JIRA 6.x the images were ignored and would not get attached.

h3.Workaround
It is possible through a customization to display the field text instead of the related image in the filter results.
Refer to [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Display+the+Issue+Type+Name+in+Issue+Navigator+Column+Beside+the+Image+Icon] page for more details.
fields.summary: Images get attached to plain text subscription and share mails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sharing a single issue from within JIRA the email address of the user that has shared the issue is being displayed in the "From" field.
In contrast, when sharing the results of filter query, the outgoing mail server "From" field is being used.
This behaviour is unexpected and inconsistent. Whenever a notification is being triggered from within JIRA, the outgoing mail server "From" field should be used.
It appears this behaviour is also showing when inviting a new user to JIRA, where the initiator is used instead of the outgoing mail "From" setting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an Issue in JIRA, and use the share button to share the issue with another user
# Create a filter query, and share the results of it with another user

h3. Expected Results
In both cases, the "From" address should be set as defined under the outgoing mail server configuration

h3. Actual Results
# The filter result share uses the address of the user sharing the issue in the "From" field
# The single issue share uses the outgoing mail server "From" address

h3. Notes
The mail headers will display the information as follows:
When sending a filter result:
{code}
From: "admin (JIRA)" <outgoing mail server address>
X-Google-Original-From: "admin (JIRA)" <user email address>
{code}

When sending a single issue:
{code}
From: "admin (JIRA)" <outgoing mail server address>
X-Google-Original-From: "admin (JIRA)" <From address as configured under the outgoing mail server>
{code}

This has been tested with Gmail.
Certain mail servers/clients will only accept the "Original-From"
fields.summary: Sharing a single issue and inviting a user uses the initiators email address opposed to the outgoing mailserver "From" field

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When you attempt to release a version in JIRA with your language set to French, the date box will autocorrect the month with a dot (ex : oct.), but the validation of the box needs the month without a dot (ex : oct). This makes it impossible to release a version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set profile or system language to French
 # Attempt to select a Start Date or End Date when creating a version in a project

h3. Expected Results

The format should follow the date picker format set in Advanced Configuration.
h3. Actual Results

Even when selecting the date from the calendar popup, the month will always have a "." at the end, which the system will not accept. Attempting to change it does not work, as when you click out of the box, the "." reappears.
h3. Workaround

Change the Date format parameters (or contact Atlassian Support to do this for Cloud customers) to a format that only uses numerals for months, such as to d/MM/yy

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/__date+and+time+formats]
h3. Workaround.2

Change the system language to English;

Perform the change in the version date;

Change back de language to French.

h3. Workaround.3

# ⚙ >> System >> General Configuration >> Advanced Settings
# Change all-numbers-date-picker Java format d/MM/yy and JavaScript format to %e/%m/%y
fields.summary: When language is set to French, date picker bug

Does not happen on pages that use browser-metrics without the sidebar, e.g. edit permission schemes in admin panel (jira/secure/admin/EditPermissions!default.jspa?schemeId=0) or edit project details dialog in admin panel (/jira/secure/project/EditProject!default.jspa?pid=10000&returnUrl=ViewProjects.jspa). fields.description:
Currently, as of Jira 7.12.3, the following scenario occurs:
# Create a mail handler that creates Issues of Issue Type X in a specific project, as in:
-- "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue"
-- "Create a new issue from each email message"
 # Remove issue type X from the project's issue type scheme

Expected result:
 The creation of issues from the mail handler will fail due to the issue type being invalid.

Actual result:
 The issue is created as issue type X

The suggestion is to either reject these emails when the mail handler is configured to use an issue type  that is not included in the project's Issue Type scheme OR to prevent an Issue Type being removed from an Issue Type scheme if there is a mail handler configured to use that Issue type for a project that has that Issue Type scheme linked.
fields.summary: JIRA allows invalid issue types to be created from a mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Project Management project for the test named PM for example.
# Create another Administrator user called "Admin"
# Create a webhook and set the JQL:
{code}project = PM AND assignee = admin{code}
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration > Issues > Workflow_
# Edit "PM: Project Management Workflow"
# Change to "Text" view and click on "Start Progress"
# Move to "Post Function" tab and make sure the post function below exist:
{code}Assign the issue to the current user. Please note that the issue will only be assigned to the current user if the current user has the 'Assignable User' permission.{code}
# Add another post function and choose "Trigger a Webhook" to select the previous webhook.
# Move it to the bottom in order to make it the last to be triggered and publish the workflow.
# Login as "admin", create an issue in PM project and click the "Start Progress" button transition.

h3. Expected Result:
With the ticket is updated its assignee to the user that triggered the transition and re-indexed, the webhook will be triggered in the last with the issue met the JQL requirement.

h3. Actual Result:
The webhook is not triggered.

h3. Notes:
Webhook will be the example for the behavior, another case will be Hipchat ticket linked below. It appears to me that the change is only happening after all the last Post Function rule. With the result where the Webhook is not triggered, it means that the Post Function Rule did not run independently as the Webhook Rule did not catch the change of the assignee. The database changes will happen after all the rule triggered it seems.
fields.summary: Webhook based on JQL would not trigger when used in Workflow Post Functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62917].
  {panel}

At this moment, when customer ran an import to JIRA Cloud, there are no warning message about user removal. 

Customer might not aware that this move will affects the other application that shared the same user management. Eg: Confluence Cloud

Confluence Cloud application will be impacted during JIRA Cloud import if they are in the same instance.

Suggesting to create a text warning message to inform customer with Confluence Cloud, that this operation (JIRA Import) will affects Confluence Cloud and user will not be able to use the application until the import is completed.
fields.summary: Warn Users during JIRA Cloud Import that Users will be removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem
While using German or French as the user language, the date picker for version releases is corrupted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# As a user, go to *User Profile* and change the language to German or French.
# Go to a Scrum board.
# Click on *Releases*
# Click on the {{...}} button for any version.
# Click on *Release*.
# Click on the date picker to choose a date.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7.x, when you create user in JIRA for delegated LDAP, it will prompt for password. [^7.x.png]. This is actually misleading as there is no need for them to set the password if it authenticated via the LDAP directory.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Administration > User management > Users
# Select _Create Users_
# Select _Delegated LDAP Authentication_ under _Directory_ field

h3. Expected Results
The password field will greyed out as there is no need to set the password since the user will be authenticated via the LDAP directory.

h3. Actual Results
It is required to set the password. [^7.x.png]
 
h3. Notes
In JIRA 6.4.x, when you create user in JIRA for delegated LDAP, it will not prompt for password configuration as the field will be greyed out. [^6.x.png] so this is actually the correct intended behaviour.

h3.Workaround
Leave the password field empty, so when the user login it will be using the LDAP password.
fields.summary: create user for delegated LDAP in JIRA should not prompt for password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62907].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
At the moment, while using JIRA and executing a series of transitions at a time, our mail boxes are spammed by mail notifications.

An example:
{format}Someone created a ticket for me.
The ticket was then assigned to me.
The description was modified four times in the same minute.
So I received five e-mails in a span of five minutes to tell me I had to work on one ticket.
{format}

h3. Solution
If e-mails were delayed by 5 minutes and then regrouped. I would have to receive only one e-mail. We still want to receive all notifications, although grouped.

h3. Workaround
Disable notifications for the specific event on the notification scheme or change the generic event that will be fired on the workflow.
fields.summary: Group notifications on JIRA notification's scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62906].
  {panel}

We would really appreciate it if the Default Component Owner could be set to Assignee on Issues that are being edited/updated.
At this time the Default Component Owner can be set to Assignee only on Issue Creation, but not edit/update.

For us, we had built a business process around Bug/Product Issue triage, and then assignment to Engineering Teams to address the issue via the Component field. We had been under the impression that the Default Component Assignee would allow us to both notify and hand off ownership of the issues but alas it does not.
Without a native solution we will need to implement our own.

-Nick
fields.summary: Allow Default Component Owner to be set to Assignee when an issue is being updated/edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62905].
  {panel}

When I receive an e-mail from a JIRA filter-subscription, the e-mail contains:
-  a header with the filter's name, number of issues, filter's comment and subscriber
- a list of all found issues incl. a link to each individual issue
- a link to edit the filter subscription

What I am missing each time I receive the mail:
A link to the filter itself, so that I can see the list of issues in Jira.

This would safe me the procedure I do currently:
- open Jira in my browser
- go to the Issues -> manage filters
- look for the subscribed filters and
- click on it to see the list of issues

I need this list in Jira for:
- seeing more properties in the table
- doing bulk changes on some issues
...
fields.summary: Filter Subscription: The sent e-mail should also contain the link to the filter-query

h3. Problem

We cannot hide or manipulate preset filters from JIRA.

As an example, if you hide a field in JIRA and try to access a preset filter that uses that field, an error will show in JIRA. If a user is not aware that the field was disabled it can think this is an error or mistakenly access this filter.

h3. Solution

Create a way to disable the plugin's module responsible for these filters or a way for the user to hide it in the interface.

h3. Workaround
None

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When there are multiple custom fields with the same name on a screen, in the "Configure Fields" dropdown menu there will be only one option for all these fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two custom fields with the same name. For example, "TestCF".
# Create a project and associate the both "TestCF" fields to the Create Issue screen of that project.
# Create a new issue in that project, a Creste Issue popup will appear.
# In the Create Issue screen click on the "Configure Fields" menu.

h3. Expected Results
In the "Configure Fields" dropdown menu the "TestCF" custom field should appear twice.

h3. Actual Results
Only one "TestCF" field appears. (See screenshot below)
 !2016-10-20_configure-fields.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
When "Show All Fields" is selected, both custom fields with the same name are correctly displayed on the screen, however if "Show Custom Fields" is selected, only one "TestCF" custom field will be displayed if the option is checked.

h3.Workaround
Use different names for the custom fields on the same screen.
fields.summary: Same name custom fields appear only once in "Configure Fields"

h3. Problem Definition 
At the moment, it is not possible to configure the X-Y axis to use Created field and this gadget does not have the ability to specify the length of period represented on the graph.

h3. Suggested Solution 
* Created field should be included in the X-Y axis option so that the data of would be dynamically generated based on Created field. 
* Include the Period option as well so that user can have the ability to specify the length of period to be displayed on the graph.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62894].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, if a user is using the wrong credential when login multiple times they will prompt to input CAPTCHA if it is enabled. Then, if we refer to the page at _JIRA Administration > User Management > User_ we could see the "Failed Login Count" is increasing and Admin will be able to reset it. But, this will remain until the user is using the right credentials to login or an Admin resets the failed login count.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Hence, it will be great if there is a Configuration that will resets the failed login count automatically in a set period of time. Just like most login feature where the user needs to wait for 5 minutes for them to make another attempt to login, this will reset the failed login count.
fields.summary: "Reset Failed Login Count" to automatically reset in a set period of time.

h3. Summary
When trying to import the XML backup generated from the Cloud instance (1000.456.2) the restore process failed with a SQL syntax error of the {{CREATE TABLE}} statement. 

h3. Environment
* XML backup generated from Cloud instance 1000.456.2
* Target JIRA Server version : 7.2.2 (PostgreSQL)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an XML backup from Cloud instance.
# Import backup to JIRA Server instance.

h3. Expected Results
Restore process finished without any error.

h3. Actual Results
Following error in UI:
{code}
There was a problem restoring ActiveObjects data for the <unknown plugin> plugin. Importing table AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT failed. Please Check the logs for details.
{code}
!Screen Shot 2016-10-25 at 5.02.28 PM.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the log file:

{noformat}
2016-10-28 19:49:30,251 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 1186x326x1 1hy1inv 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unsupported field encountered: binary
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unsupported field encountered: binary
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$BaseInserter.setValue(DataImporter.java:372)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.importTable(DataImporter.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.access$000(DataImporter.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.jdbc.JdbcUtils.withConnection(JdbcUtils.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.doImportNode(DataImporter.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

And

{noformat}
2016-10-19 13:36:47,196 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR administrator 816x98x1 6feeel 192.168.0.40 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin> (table AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT):Error executing update for SQL statement 'CREATE TABLE public."AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT" (
    "FILTER_CONFIGURATION" TEXT,
    "FILTER_CONFIG_HASH" INTEGER,
    "HASH" TEXT,
    "HIERARCHY_LEVEL" INTEGER,
    "ID" BIGSERIAL,
    "PLAN_ID" BIGINT,
    "REPORT_CONFIGURATION" TEXT,
    "REPORT_CONFIG_HASH" INTEGER,
    "REPORT_ID" TEXT,
)'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.TableDefinitionImporter.doImportNode(TableDefinitionImporter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: syntax error at or near ")"
  Position: 295
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2101)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1834)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:255)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:510)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeUpdate(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:300)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:34)
	... 19 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The issue is caused by two tables which do not have a primary key defined:
* {{AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT}} which is used by JIRA Portfolio Plugin (This is a bundled system plugin in Cloud instance)
{code}
jira=> \d "AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT"
                                 Table "public.AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT"
        Column        |  Type   |                               Modifiers
----------------------+---------+------------------------------------------------------------------------
 ID                   | bigint  | not null default nextval('"AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT_ID_seq"'::regclass)
 HASH                 | text    | not null
 PLAN_ID              | bigint  | not null
 REPORT_ID            | text    | not null
 REPORT_CONFIGURATION | text    |
 FILTER_CONFIGURATION | text    | not null
 HIERARCHY_LEVEL      | integer | not null
 REPORT_CONFIG_HASH   | integer |
 FILTER_CONFIG_HASH   | integer |
{code}
* {{CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A}} which is used by a Cloud specific plugin.
{code}
jira=> \d CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A
Table "public.connect_plugin_modules_f4ed3a"
 Column | Type  | Modifiers
--------+-------+-----------
 data   | bytea | not null
{code}

Once we modified the {{activeobjects.xml}} file by setting a primary key to the relevant table, the error disappeared.

h3.Workaround
* If these tables do not contain any data, we can manually modify the {{activeobjects.xml}} file by removing both tables' definition and data:
** Search for {{"<table name="AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT">"}} and {{"<table name="CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A">"}}, remove these two {{table}} entities.
** Search for {{"<data tableName="AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT">"}} and {{"<data tableName="CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A">"}}, remove these two {{data}} entities.
* If there are any data in the {{AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT}} table, we can set the primary key to the ID column by searching for 
{code}
<table name="AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT"><column name="ID" primaryKey="false"
{code} and changing the {{primaryKey}} value from "false" to "true".
** Since the table {{CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A}} is Cloud-specific we can remove it from the {{activeobjects.xml}} file as described in the above workaround.
fields.summary: Import of cloud backup to server fails with SQL exception due to missing primary key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Filter Results gadget does not preserve the Filter column order if modifications are made in the gadget UI by the Owner of the gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue filter Eg: {{issuetype = Bug AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY key ASC}}. This will sort all issues by Key. 
# Go to the dashboard and add a filter results gadget
# Here select the filter you just created and save the gadget
# The the issues will appear in the gadget respecting the filter order Key ASC. 
# Any other user can click on any column heading to temporariily sort as per that column. Once refreshed this will be lost and will not affect other users. 
# When the owner of the gadget click on any column heading to temporariily sort as per that column.

h3. Expected Results
Only the owner can see the sorting change, which is temporary. 

h3. Actual Results
* The change persists even after refresh. 
* All users who have access to the dashboard can see this change. 
 
h3. Notes
This can be an issue in scenarios where a team lead creates a dashboard for a filter by prority from which users have to work on. However, the owner performing sorting from the dashboard can negatively affect other users who may work on lower priority issues.
fields.summary: The Filter Results gadget does not preserve the Filter column order if modifications are made in the gadget UI by the Owner

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62881].
  {panel}
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7.3, Project Administrators are allowed to edit the projects workflow with restrictions
{panel}We've extended the project administrators permission, so that project administrators can now edit their projects workflow under certain conditions:
* The workflow must not be shared with any other projects
* The workflow cannot be the JIRA default system workflow, which cannot be edited at all

The project admins will not be able to edit the workflow to the same extent as a JIRA administrator. The restrictions are:
* To add a status, the status must already exist in the JIRA instance i.e. the project admin can't create new statuses or edit existing statuses
* The project admin isn't allowed to delete a status from the workflow
* The project admin can create, update or delete transitions, but they can't select or update a screen used by the transition, or edit a transition's properties, conditions, validators or post-functions
{panel}

h3. Suggestion
To extend this feature, it would help if
* It would be great if someone assigned this permission can edit any Workflow which is only assigned to projects which they manage (in addition to Worlflows which are only attached to a single project).
* To have ability to edit the transition properties, conditions, validators or post-functions
fields.summary: Extended Project Admin Permissions - Workflow Management

h2. Summary
When deleting a last viewed project, a velocity code is displaying on the back-to-project button

h2. Environment
JIRA v1000.383.3

h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Go to cogwheel and click on *Projects*
# Click on any project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62876].
  {panel}

Scenario: -
--> Try to filter JIRA with component which contains a particular text like “ABC”
i.e. using filter [component ~ "ABC"]

You will notice that JIRA will give error as below: -
“The operator '~' is not supported by the 'component' field.”

Let us say I have many components starting with ABC like : - 
1) ABC-123
2) ABC-456
3) ABC-789
and so on.

If I want to filter JIRA using component field like [component ~ "ABC"]
It will give me above mentioned error.

To filter JIRA, I have to filter it using [component in ("ABC-123", "ABC-456", "ABC-789", ......... .....)], which is not user-friendly or I have to remember all components. If my admin has added few more, I would not know unless he/she tells me and I add those components in my already having filter with this in clause.

Another example is for https://jira.atlassian.com is , if I want to filter issues with component starting with/containing "Issue Navigation", I cannot do that.

So, there should be some way to filter component/labels using contains clause i.e. using ~
fields.summary: Ability to Filter Issues by component/labels but with contains/like clause. i.e. with ~ option.

h3. Problem Definition

After attaching .*mov* & *.mkv* video file formats in an issue, clicking on it will *download* the file rather than *preview* it on the issue itself.

Unlike other video formats such as .*ogv* and *mp4* which do preview the video on the issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62872].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

* [Time Reports and Gadgets plugin developer/vendor, Andriy Zhdanov|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/120] has reported that they are experiencing a malfunction of the IssueLinkManager API in JIRA 7. 
* The problem is that issue object returned by IssueLinkManager is somewhat incorrectly initialized and is considered as SubTask, and has itself as parent issue.
* Basically the observation is that the issue object is incorrectly initialized in the *IssueLinkManager API* as a subtask. Notice from screenshot of a live debugging, how linkedIssue.isSubTask() is true, while cleanLinkedIssue.isSubtask() is false for the same issue.
!linkedIssue.png|thumbnail!
* According to customer same code works fine in JIRA 6, and only has this behaviour from JIRA 7.x. If there's at all need to make any reference to the plugin's source code, it is available at https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet, however, since it's our java API issue I'm assuming that may not be necessary. Relevant or affected code from our API can be seen from screenshot to some extent. 

*Worth to mention:*
Bug is in the method {{IssueLinkManager#getLinkCollection}}. All outgoing issues have parameter {{parent}} set to itself.
Introduced in [this|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/pull-requests/5475/overview] PR.
fields.summary: Issue object returned by IssueLinkManager is linked to itself

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62871].
  {panel}

Problem Definition
 For example, searching for {{-1d}} vs {{-24h}} in query gives completely different results. However this is not highlighted or explained in our documentation.
 * When specifying {{-1d}}, it will start calculating on the day when you executed it (which includes today itself if you execute the query now). It does not take into account the amount of time relative to the time you had executed it, ie 24 hours from the time you executed the JQL.
 * When specifying {{-24h}}, it will start calculating from the hour when you executed it, ie 24 hours from the time you executed the JQL.

Let's assume there is an issue that was transitioned to "Closed" yesterday 3PM, and the query is executed 1PM today:
 * {{status changed to "Closed" after -1d}} will not return the result but {{status changed to "Closed" after -2d}} will
 * {{status changed to "Closed" after -24h}} will return the result

Suggested Solution
 Include a section in Advanced JQL Search documentation to explain the differences.
fields.summary: Difference between Day & Time search is not explained in any JQL documentation

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there are two way for importing issues:
# Import issues from CSV (for all the users)
# External system import

If first option which is widely used by all the users in JIRA the issue key is not available in the drop down mapping field

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62864].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian Jira Team!
 
We are using Kanban methodology, so we have no sprints, although we have a few tasks that should be done biweekely, on a selected day to make it a routine.
Scheduled issues could be the perfect solution for that.
Except the fact, that it literally seems impossible right now to schedule issues for every 2 weeks on mondays, using default or advanced cron expressions.

We tried: 
-  0 0 1-7,15-21 * 1  
- 0 0 1-7,15-21 * MON
and so many more. Jira did not accept these, only parts of that expression.

*Actual behaviour*: Setting a biweekly trigger for a selected day of week seems to be a missing basic feature at the moment. 
When we add e.g. second and last Mondays for trigger, sometimes it takes 3 weeks sometimes 2 weeks in between. Its not acceptable.
(second monday  of october is oct.10, last is october 31, that is 3 weeks, but for november the trigger would work)
 
*Expected behaviour*: Possible scheduled issue trigger biweekly on a chosen day of week, please. Would be nice as "Days per Biweek" as a preset schedule.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Make 2 weekly scheduled issues possible
